title.rendered: Gaming: Gambling has this advantage for your brain

content.rendered:
fight number sense

Computer games have this advantage for your brain

Published on 06.05.2022| Reading time: 2 minutes

Source: Getty Images/La Bicicleta Vermella

Hours of fiddling in front of the screen makes you stupid and your eyes bad, our parents used to want us to believe. Computer games also have a positive effect on our cognitive abilities.

Gambling trains the ability to concentrate and trains the working memory. Gamers often learn faster and better. The game “Super Mario” even promotes the growth of certain brain regions. The neuroscientists Joana Stäb and Uwe Ilg from the Hertie Institute for Clinical Brain Research at the University of Tübingen have now discovered another positive effect:

Video games train our so-called number sense, so that we can estimate quantities better.

The following applies: the more, the better. The effect is probably due to the brain’s increased attention, as the researchers write in a press release. The ability to correctly estimate the number of objects at a glance is innate in us humans. For example, we don’t have to count every single apple to find out that there are three in the shopping cart.

Source: Getty Images/PhotoAlto/Isabelle Rozenbaum

The same applies to the number sense as to our other senses: the smaller the difference between two stimuli, such as the size of a quantity or the pitch of a tone, the more difficult it is for us to perceive it.

However, we can train our perception. Musicians, for example, perceive very subtle differences in loudness. We were interested in whether the number sense can also be trained.

For their study, which was published in the journal Addiction Biology, the researchers tested a total of 66 subjects. Half gambled more than four hours a week on the computer, the other half not even one. In the experiments, the study participants looked at two circles on a screen that contained black dots. Subjects were asked to spontaneously indicate which had more.

Animal gamers

The result: the computer players made just as many mistakes as the non-players. If the number of points differed only slightly, they clearly had the edge and were superior. You could see the differences much better. Even more:

The more players gambled during the week, the finer their numerical perception was.

Source: Getty Images/Andriy Onufriyenko

“To put it simply: Computer players can intuitively and without counting better distinguish whether there are more apples or more oranges in the shopping cart,” Ilg explains the study result.

So the ability to estimate quantities at a glance can actually be trained.

The scientists assume that computer games improve the brain’s ability to direct and control attention.

But with all the advantages that gaming has on our cognitive abilities, the researchers also warn: “Every coin has two sides – excessive computer gaming can lead to addiction, this is officially recognized as a disease.” They therefore advise moderate gaming, the computer turn it off again and again and put the games console aside.

Matching:

This article was first published in June 2021.
